citations.narrative:
Three covered feed containers storing bird feed were not being stored in a manner that allows for cleaning. Two
containers were approximately 10 gallon sized plastic storage totes and one was a reused 32 oz chip container. They
were placed above a sanded floor and were in direct contact with free roaming birds within their primary enclosure. These
containers were away from the wall which allowed for the accumulation of discarded nesting material and feathers to build
up behind it. Located on the lids were minor amounts of bird droppings. Storing feed containers this way, encourages
birds to perch above them. The combination of bird droppings, feathers, and discarded nesting materials, makes it difficult
to maintain a clean area around the food supply. Supplies of food, including food supplements, bedding, and substrate
must be stored off the floor and away from the walls, to allow cleaning underneath and around the supplies. It must be
stored in a manner to protect the supplies from deterioration, harmful microbial growth, contamination, and vermin
infestation.
To be corrected by 8/4/2025.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The environment enhancement plan was incomplete. It did not make provisions for social grouping, environment
enrichment, special consideration, restraint devices, and exemptions. A complete environmental enhancement plan is
necessary for promoting the psychological well-being of the birds. The licensee must develop, document and follow an
environmental enhancement plan that addresses all of these requirements. The plan must be approved by the attending
veterinarian.
To be corrected by 8/4/2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.150(e) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Three covered feed containers storing bird feed were not being stored in a manner that allows for cleaning. Two 
containers were approximately 10 gallon sized plastic storage totes and one was a reused 32 oz chip container. They 
were placed above a sanded floor and were in direct contact with free roaming birds within their primary enclosure. These 
containers were away from the wall which allowed for the accumulation of discarded nesting material and feathers to build 
up behind it. Located on the lids were minor amounts of bird droppings. Storing feed containers this way, encourages 
birds to perch above them. The combination of bird droppings, feathers, and discarded nesting materials, makes it difficult 
to maintain a clean area around the food supply. Supplies of food, including food supplements, bedding, and substrate 
must be stored off the floor and away from the walls, to allow cleaning underneath and around the supplies. It must be 
stored in a manner to protect the supplies from deterioration, harmful microbial growth, contamination, and vermin 
infestation.  
 
To be corrected by 8/4/2025. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The environment enhancement plan was incomplete. It did not make provisions for social grouping, environment 
enrichment, special consideration, restraint devices, and exemptions. A complete environmental enhancement plan is 
necessary for promoting the psychological well-being of the birds. The licensee must develop, document and follow an 
environmental enhancement plan that addresses all of these requirements. The plan must be approved by the attending 
veterinarian. 
 
To be corrected by 8/4/2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.

n
